name: Siberian Tiger
description: The Siberian Tiger is the largest big cat, known for its thick fur and powerful build.
spread_note: Found in eastern Russia and parts of China.
food_note: Ambushes prey, often in snowy terrain.
proportions: Length: 2.7-3.3 m, height: 1-1.2 m, weight: 180-300 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 3.5 months, litters of 2-4 cubs.
attractions: Major attraction in zoos for their majesty.
projects_note: Endangered due to poaching and habitat loss; conservation is critical.
breeding: Bred in captivity for population recovery.
